noun.description: An unexpected, minor, and typically temporary deviation from a general trend.
examples: an upward blip in house prices

noun.description: A short high-pitched sound made by an electronic device.

verb.description: (of an electronic device) make a short high-pitched sound or succession of sounds.
Open (the throttle of a motor vehicle) momentarily.

origin: Late 19th century (denoting a sudden rap or tap): imitative; the noun sense unexpected deviation dates from the 1970s.
